Key Match Events: Florian Wirtz scored within seven seconds of kick-off, rifling his shot into the top corner of Brice Samba's goal, via the underside of the bar.
Jamal Musiala rounded Samba, before cutting the ball back for Kai Havertz to double Germany's advantage.
Post-Match Reflections: Didier Deschamps said that France was 'outclassed in every department' in the match against Germany.
Aurélien Tchouaméni analyzed France's defeat to Germany, stating that the team was outclassed in every department.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was an international friendly, and it was France's penultimate match before this summer's Euros.

Germany's win marked a comprehensive defeat for France, who struggled to gain a foothold in the game with a lack of intensity in and out of possession and a string of uncharacteristic technical errors.
Others: The match was played at the Groupama Stadium in Lyon, and fans at the stadium chanted for changes in the second half.
Germany's midfielder Kai Havertz celebrated after scoring Germany's second goal in the match.
